definition: to keep accounts/bookkeeping/to charge to an account
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Double-entry-accounting: A system of recording every business transaction with equal dollar amounts of both debit and credit entries.
sentences.chinese: 在借方和贷方用相等的金额记录经济事项的记账系统。

sentences.english: If you’ve never tracked your expenses, try the One Month Challenge.
sentences.chinese: 如果你从不记账，可以先尝试“一个月账本”。

sentences.english: Choosing standard money of charge to an account is business accounting of accounting of industry of condition foreign enterprise cannot evasive problem.
sentences.chinese: 选择记账本位币是境外企业会计核算不能回避的问题。

sentences.english: A general journal can be used to record all types of transactions.
sentences.chinese: 普通日记账可以被用来记录所有类型的业务。

sentences.english: Other journal types will be converted at the closing or average rates.
sentences.chinese: 其他日记账类型将以期末汇率或平均汇率转换。

sentences.english: We are just talking about accounting, Charlie.
sentences.chinese: 我们讨论的是会计记账，查理。

sentences.english: Each posting period is defined by a start and a finish date.
sentences.chinese: 每一个记账期间有确定的起止日期。

sentences.english: The transactions are based on the double-entry bookkeeping system and the multi - currency principle.
sentences.chinese: 业务记录采用复式记账并支持多币种。

sentences.english: The journal is the chronological record of business transactions.
sentences.chinese: 日记账是经济业务的序时记录。

sentences.english: The basic principle of double entry bookkeeping is that every transaction has a twofold effect.
sentences.chinese: 复式记账法的基本原理是每笔交易都有借贷双方。

sentences.english: A fine of millions of marks was imposed for a single bookkeeping error.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅是一个记账错误就会受到数以百万马克的罚款。

sentences.english: In this book, we use general journal to explain the process of journalizing and posting.
sentences.chinese: 本书中，我们会用总账来解释记账和过账的过程。

sentences.english: It's just a formality but for hire-purchase we usually require references.
sentences.chinese: 按照手续，记账购货我们通常是需要担保的。

sentences.english: The journal record the transactions day by day and shows an explanation of each transaction.
sentences.chinese: 日记账记录每天发生业务及业务解释。

sentences.english: The joint venture company adopts RMB as its accounts keeping unit.
sentences.chinese: 合营公司采用人民币为记账本位币。

sentences.english: The debit and credit double entry bookkeeping technique is to be used for recording alt accounting transactions.
sentences.chinese: 会计上所有交易的记录都采用借贷复式记账法。

definition: to verify accounting records/also written 對帳|对帐[dui4 zhang4]
to verify accounting records/also written 對賬|对账[dui4 zhang4]
lit. to open a water source and reduce outflow (idiom); to increase income and save on spending/to broaden the sources of income and economize on expenditure
